title: Rustic Script ID
content:
I need to know what font the "Bold" and "Lion" are in. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-05%20at%201_4703.33.13%20PM.png)

Font: 

 LD Abe Lincoln 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-11-05 at 1.33.13 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-05%20at%201.33.13%20PM.png) | 43.83 KB |
author: kvnrangel

comments.content:
Close: it's called Abe Lincoln or ALincoln but I cannot find current sources.  
 [![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548im_/http:/i.imgur.com/vOig1mN.jpg " imgur.com")](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548/http:/imgur.com/vOig1mN)

It is currently listed as a free for personal use font on Dafont. It also carries a copyright by Steve Woolf (2012) and is based on a manuscript of the Gettysburg Address. It reminded me of a lot of the Three Island Press handwriting scripts.

I found the A Lincoln Font on dafont and it appears to be slightly different from the sample that DPape provided. I then searched for Abe Lincoln and found this font called LD Abe Lincoln [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-delights/ld-abe-lincoln/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170548/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-delights/ld-abe-lincoln/). Thanks to the both of you.
